author: Ralph K.M. Haurwitz
title: Public forum at UT to gather comments on new campus carry law
text:
University of Texas officials are expected to hear from students, employees, alumni and others at a public forum Wednesday evening about a new state law expanding the rights of concealed handgun license holders to carry weapons on public college campuses.
The forum runs from 7 to 9 p.m. at the Texas Union. A second forum will be held at 3 p.m. Monday.
License holders are already permitted under state law to carry handguns on college grounds. The new law, effective August 2016, allows carrying in campus buildings.
Universities are permitted to establish rules declaring some locations off-limits and regarding storage of handguns in campus dormitories. But the law, Senate Bill 11, says the rules may not “generally prohibit” license holders from carrying their guns on campus.
The forums are sponsored by a 19-member panel established by UT President Gregory L. Fenves to make recommendations.
